title: RBI Governor Seeks to Clear Up Market Confusion on Rate Outlook
content: India’s central bank may have space for further policy easing if inflation undershoots its projections, said Governor Sanjay Malhotra, seeking to address market confusion sparked by his earlier remarks that the authority has limited room for easing.

title: Live: FTSE 100 Falls in Broad Selloff, UK Bond Yields Rise
Europe Gas Edges Higher as Israel-Iran Conflict Threatens Trade
content: European natural gas prices moved higher as traders braced for a potential escalation in the Israel-Iran conflict and risks for global energy supplies.

title: Japan Bond Futures Dip After BOJ Plans Slower Bond Buying Cuts
content: Japanese bond futures slipped after the central bank held rates steady and said it would slow its tapering of government bond buying from the start of the next fiscal year.

title: Autodoc Backers Seek Up to €403 Million in Frankfurt Listing
content: Autodoc SE’s owners are looking to raise as much as €403 million ($466 million) in one of Germany’s largest initial share sales so far this year.

title: Horizons Middle East & Africa 06/17/2025
content: Horizons Middle East & Africa is your daily spotlight on one of the world's fastest-growing regions. Live from Dubai, we bring you the latest global markets and analysis, plus news-making interviews, with a special focus on MEA. All that and more, as you head to the office in the Gulf, pause for lunch in Hong Kong, or start your day in London or Johannesburg.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Oil Fluctuates as Traders Watch for Israel-Iran War Escalation
content: Oil fluctuated as traders parsed comments from President Donald Trump on the conflict between Israel and Iran, with the market on edge about potential crude supply disruptions in the Middle East.

title: Gold Steady After Trump’s Tehran Warning Sparks Haven Buying
content: Gold steadied after rising early Tuesday when US President Donald Trump called for the immediate evacuation of Tehran, boosting demand for havens as investors track hostilities between Israel and Iran.

title: Germany Discusses Creating State-Owned Strategic Gas Storage
content: Germany is examining whether it should create a strategic store of gas, a smaller version of America’s emergency oil reserve, according to people familiar with the plans.

title: Mitsubishi Said in Advanced Talks on $8 Billion Aethon Deal
content: Mitsubishi Corp. is in advanced talks to buy the assets of Aethon Energy Management for close to $8 billion, people familiar with the matter said, in what would be the Japanese conglomerate’s biggest ever acquisition.

title: Methanol Spikes in China on Concern About Shipments From Iran
content: Methanol prices have surged in China on concern hostilities between Israel and Iran could disrupt exports of the plastics raw material.

title: Stock Futures Drop, Oil Rises With Iran in Focus: Markets Wrap
content: US and European stock futures fell and oil rose after President Donald Trump called for the evacuation of Tehran, in comments that contrasted with earlier optimism that Israel-Iran tensions wouldn’t escalate into a wider conflict.

title: More Central Banks Than Ever Plan to Build Up Their Gold Hoards
content: A record share of the world’s central banks plans to accumulate more gold over the next 12 months, drawn by bullion’s performance during times of crisis and protection against inflation.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 6/17/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Citi Calls Time on Gold’s Rally on Slumping Demand, Fed Cuts
content: Gold is expected to sink back below $3,000 an ounce in the coming quarters as a record-setting run peters out, according to Citigroup Inc., calling time on one of the standout rallies in commodities.

title: Fuel Tanker Rates Surge as Mideast Conflict Puts Hormuz in Focus
content: Tanker rates for vessels carrying refined oil products from the Middle East have surged in recent days, as the exchange of fire between Israel and Iran makes hauling fuel through the Strait of Hormuz more risky.

title: Trump Leaves G-7 Early as Israel-Iran Tension Spikes
content: President Donald Trump’s hasty exit from the Group of Seven conference in Canada deepened questions about his promise to bring peace to an increasingly violent world and added fresh evidence of his skepticism toward the institutions that have long underpinned US diplomacy. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Oil Jumps After Trump Calls for Tehran Evacuation
content: Oil prices rose after US President Donald Trump called for the evacuation of Tehran, before paring gains. The market remains on edge about an escalation in the conflict between Israel and Iran and its potential to disrupt crude supply. Bloomberg’s Anthony di Paola reports.

title: For Markets, the Israel-Iran War Is Already Over
content: Risks to the oil price and global economy appear likely to stay contained.

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 06/17/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Abu Dhabi’s $19 Billion Offer Drives Push for Top LNG Ranks
content: Abu Dhabi is boosting its ambitions to build a top liquefied natural gas producer with its biggest energy deal, as the petrostate targets a market it sees as key to its economic growth.

title: Trump to Miss Albanese Meeting at G-7
content: A planned meeting between President Donald Trump and Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese at the G-7 summit in Canada has been scrapped, following Trump's abrupt exit due to the escalating crisis in the Middle East. The American Chamber of Commerce in Australia says there are still positive signs for the relationship between the two countries, and sees a chance for the two leaders to meet at the next Quad gathering in India. AmCham Australia CEO April Palmerlee shares her outlook on Australia-US relations on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Foshan Haitian Raises $1.3 Billion in Upsized Hong Kong Listing
content: Foshan Haitian Flavouring & Food Co. has raised HK$10.1 billion ($1.3 billion) after robust demand for its shares to be listed in Hong Kong allowed China’s biggest soy sauce maker to increase the deal size.

title: Global Euro Moment Needs Decisive Action, ECB’s Lagarde Says
content: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde called on policymakers to seize the moment and increase the euro’s global profile as Donald Trump’s policies undermines confidence in the US dollar.

title: The Asia Trade: 6/17/2025
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Paul Allen, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: India’s MCX Bourse Said to Launch Electricity Futures This Year
content: Multi Commodity Exchange of India Ltd., the nation’s largest commodities bourse, will introduce electricity futures later this year, according to people familiar with the matter who asked not to be identified as the information is still private.

title: Bank of Japan Holds Rates, Plans Slower Withdrawal From Bond Market
content: The Bank of Japan left its benchmark rate unchanged on Tuesday and said it would slow its tapering of government bond buying from the start of the next fiscal year. Bloomberg's Shery Ahn reports from Tokyo. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: China Eases Battery, Steel Scrap Import Rules to Aid Green Push
content: China is relaxing import regulations on scrap, a move that will support recycling of battery metals and help speed the green transition in the steel market.

title: Britain's Housing Splurge Is Long Overdue
content: The Labour government’s plan to boost spending on affordable homes has the potential to pay for itself in wider economic benefits.

title: Trump ‘Revenge’ Tax Prompts AMP to Halt Long-Term US Investments
content: One of Australia’s top asset managers has frozen new long-term investments in the US, citing mounting uncertainty over President Donald Trump’s policies.

title: Irish State Exits AIB, Putting Bank Into Private Ownership
content: The Irish state has disposed of the remainder of its shareholding in AIB Group plc, putting the bank into private ownership.

title: Trump Plays Down Iran-Israel Ceasefire as He Leaves G-7 Early
content: US President Donald Trump left the Group of Seven leaders meeting in Canada early to deal with the Israel-Iran conflict, but played down the chances of a ceasefire.

title: Reeves Weighs Reversing Non-Dom Inheritance Tax Changes, FT Says
content: Rachel Reeves is considering reversing a decision to charge inheritance tax on the overseas assets of non-doms, according to the Financial Times.

title: Trump Says G-7 Exit for ‘Much Bigger’ Reason Than Ceasefire
content: US President Donald Trump said his early departure from the Group of Seven leaders meeting in Canada has “nothing to do” with working on a ceasefire between Israel and Iran, instead saying his reason is “much bigger than that.”

title: EU Refused Meeting With China on Lack of Trade Progress, FT Says
content: The European Union is refusing to hold an economic meeting with China due to a lack of progress on trade disputes, the Financial Times reports, underscoring tensions between the two sides even as Beijing tries to warm ties.

title: Russian Air Strikes Pound Kyiv as Trump Goes Slow on Sanctions
content: Russian air strikes killed at least 14 people in Kyiv as multiple locations in the Ukrainian capital were hit by drones and missiles or struck by intercepted projectiles.

title: Israel’s Air Shield Is Tested Like Never Before as Iran Fires Ballistic Missiles
content: As Iran fires masses of ballistic missiles, Israel’s vaunted air defenses are being tested like never before.

title: Trump Tax Bill to Boost Biden’s Chip Tax Credit to 30%
content: The Senate’s draft tax bill calls for increasing an investment credit for semiconductor manufacturers, a potential boon for chipmakers that the Trump administration is urging to increase the size of their US projects.

title: G-7 Leaders Seek ‘Resolution’ of Iranian Crisis in Statement
content: The Group of Seven leaders pushed for a de-escalation in the Middle East but didn’t call for an immediate end to the conflict between Israel and Iran in a statement that also affirmed Israel’s right to defend itself.

title: Trump Leaves G-7 Summit Early as Israel-Iran Tension Spikes
content: President Donald Trump’s hasty exit from the Group of Seven conference in Canada deepened questions about his promise to bring peace to an increasingly violent world and added fresh evidence of his skepticism toward the institutions that have long underpinned US diplomacy.

title: Britain's Housing Splurge Is Long Overdue
content: The Labour government’s plan to boost spending on affordable homes has the potential to pay for itself in wider economic benefits.

title: Australian PM’s Meeting With Trump Scrapped After G-7 Departure
content: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese’s first in-person meeting with Donald Trump was canceled after the president decided to leave a Group of Seven summit early to focus on the conflict between Israel and Iran.

title: Trump Set to Depart G-7 Early as Israel-Iran Tension Spikes
content: President Donald Trump is set to depart the Group of Seven leaders’ summit in Canada a day early, after warning residents of Tehran to evacuate the city as Israel continued to bombard Iran in a bid to disable its nuclear program.

title: Trump, Ishiba Fail to Reach Trade Deal at G-7 Summit
content: US President Donald Trump and Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba failed to reach an agreement on a trade package on the sidelines of the Group of Seven summit, an outcome that leaves the Asian nation inching closer to a possible recession as the pain of US tariffs hits its economy.

title: China Warns Iran-Israel Conflict May Spiral, Calls for Peace
content: China warned the Iran-Israel conflict may spread wider instability in the Middle East, with Foreign Minister Wang Yi reaching out to both countries as their days-old conflict shows no end in sight.

title: US Defeats Teachers Unions’ Suit to Restore Columbia Funding
content: The Trump administration won dismissal of a lawsuit by two unions seeking to stop the withholding of $400 million in federal funds from Columbia University, saying the groups didn’t have the legal right to challenge the decision.

title: OpenAI Snags $200 Million Contract With US Defense Department
content: OpenAI has won a $200 million contract for a pilot program aimed at helping the US Defense Department determine how it could use artificial intelligence for a range of administrative and security tasks.

title: Brazil Congress Threatens to Deal Fresh Blow to Lula Fiscal Plan
content: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s efforts to shore up Brazil’s budget are on the brink of another setback after Congress advanced a push to block tax increases on some financial transactions from taking effect.

title: What’s New in the Senate Version of Trump’s Tax and Spending Bill
content: Senate Republicans plan to modify President Donald Trump’s massive fiscal package to lower maximum deductions for state and local taxes and limit the impact of a “revenge” tax on foreign investors.

title: Wind, Solar Credits Set to End Early in Senate GOP Tax Bill
content: Senate Republicans released a bill that would end tax credits for wind and solar earlier than for other sources, and make only modest changes to most other incentives, dashing hopes of those seeking relief from major cuts passed by the House.

title: Trump to Leave G-7 Summit and Return to Washington on Monday
content: President Donald Trump is cutting short his visit to the Group of Seven leaders’ summit, according to the White House, and returning to Washington.

title: US Approves Sale of $2 Billion in Military Hardware to Australia
content: The US State Department has signed off on the potential sale of military hardware to Australia valued at an estimated $2 billion (A$3.1 billion), including fighter jet spare parts.

title: Senate Republican Tax Bill Would End Federal Taxes on Many Guns, Silencers
content: Senate Republicans’ tax bill would eliminate federal taxes and regulations on short-barreled rifles, short-barreled shotguns and silencers as well as preempt state or local licensing requirements in a win for gun-rights advocates.

title: Senate Republicans Release Revised Tax Cuts and Debt Limit Bill
content: Senate Republicans propose to cut trillions of dollars in taxes for households and businesses in their version of President Donald Trump’s signature economic package, a plan that comes at the expense of curbing health coverage for some low-income Americans and adding to US deficits.

title: Senate Republicans Propose More Aggressive Medicaid Cuts to Help Pay for Tax Bill
content: Senate Republicans are proposing cuts to the Medicaid program for low-income and disabled people that are more aggressive than policies the House passed to help pay for President Donald Trump’s sweeping tax package.

title: Minnesota Shooting Suspect Faces US Charges Including Murder
content: US prosecutors charged alleged shooter Vance Boelter with two counts of murder in the deaths of Minnesota State Representative Melissa Hortman and her husband, in what officials referred to as a “murderous rampage” on Saturday morning.

title: Rich Colleges Would Face Lower Tax Hike Under Senate Bill
content: Wealthy US colleges scored a win on Monday with the release of Senate Republicans’ tax bill, which would institute a lower tax increase on endowments than what GOP House members have backed.

title: US Won’t Back G-7’s Iran De-Escalation Push in Sign of Disunity
content: The US is blocking a proposed Group of Seven statement urging Israel and Iran to de-escalate their conflict, people familiar with the matter said, highlighting the distance that’s opened up between President Donald Trump and other members of the bloc.

title: Senate Delays and Scales Back ‘Revenge Tax’ in Trump Bill
content: Senate Republicans plan to delay and make less onerous a levy targeting foreign companies and investors from countries that the US determines have been unfairly taxing US companies.

title: Trump Says Russia Sanctions Would Cost US ‘a Lot of Money’
content: US President Donald Trump indicated at the Group of Seven summit that he is in no rush to impose tougher sanctions on Russia, dismissing pressure from allied leaders eager to do more to push Moscow to the negotiating table.

title: Meta Testing New Auto-Generated Video Ads as Part of AI Push
content: Meta Platforms Inc., the owner of Facebook and Instagram, is pushing deeper into AI-generated advertisements in a bid to make it cheaper and simpler for marketers to craft their messages.

title: Israel’s Air Shield Is Tested Like Never Before as Iran Fires Ballistic Missiles
content: As Iran fires masses of ballistic missiles, Israel’s vaunted air defenses are being tested like never before.

title: Trump Tax Bill to Boost Biden’s Chip Tax Credit to 30%
content: The Senate’s draft tax bill calls for increasing an investment credit for semiconductor manufacturers, a potential boon for chipmakers that the Trump administration is urging to increase the size of their US projects.

title: Tinder Debuts Revamped Double-Dating Feature in US After Failed 2016 Launch
content: Tinder is bringing a double-dating feature back to the US, revamping a controversial product it shelved in 2017 over privacy concerns and ambiguity about whether the option was meant for monogamous people.

title: Auterion Strikes Deal With Taiwan for Unmanned Drone Software
content: Taiwan has struck a multi-year deal with US-based defense technology company Auterion to engineer autonomous vehicles that could deter threats from China.

title: SoftBank Sells T-Mobile Stake for $4.8 Billion to Fund AI Push
content: SoftBank Group Corp. raised around $4.8 billion through a sale of T-Mobile US Inc. shares, a move that helps fund the Japanese company’s grandiose plans for artificial intelligence.

title: China Joins US in Brain Implant Race With Clinical Trial
content: China’s first clinical trial of a technology that allows signals from the brain to control an external device has shown early signs of success, making it only the second country after the US to reach this stage, according to the Global Times.

title: OpenAI Snags $200 Million Contract With US Defense Department
content: OpenAI has won a $200 million contract for a pilot program aimed at helping the US Defense Department determine how it could use artificial intelligence for a range of administrative and security tasks.

title: Hedge Fund Up 42% Last Year Offloads Its Biggest Winner Nvidia
content: Hedge fund founder Jonah Cheng calls Nvidia Corp. the best pick of his career. But he has now sold the last of his shares in the company, expressing doubts about the outlook for the $3.5 trillion chipmaker.

title: Washington Post Probes Hack of Journalist Email Accounts
content: The Washington Post is investigating a cyberattack on the email accounts of some journalists, prompting the newspaper to beef up its online security.

title: Trump To Launch Mobile Services, New Training for Robots | Bloomberg Tech 6/16/2025
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss the Trump family’s plan for a self-branded mobile phone service. Plus, Meta launches ads on the privacy-focused messaging service WhatsApp. And robotics firm 1X Technologies announces a new “World Model” to train robots on the physical world using data-driven simulations.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Warner Bros. Wins Support From Bondholders for Debt Overhaul
content: Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. said it won enough support from creditors to overhaul its debt as part of a plan to split into two separate companies, a significant victory for the entertainment giant as it tries to turn itself around.

title: Scale AI’s Wang Brings to Meta Knowledge of What Everyone Else is Doing
content: Scale AI co-founder Alexandr Wang is such an enthusiastic networker that his former roommate — OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman — once jokingly told him to tone it down a bit.

title: SFR Working to Restore Wireless Service Across France With Fix
content: Phone carrier SFR said it’s working on restoring mobile service after an issue caused a widespread mobile network outage across France.

title: Nintendo Switch 2 Review: Bigger and Mostly Better
content: The second-generation Switch brings design improvements and faster performance, but the battery life and game selection underwhelm.

title: BC Partners-Backed Telco United Group Names KPN Alum as CEO
content: United Group, the southeastern European telecom operator owned by BC Partners, appointed former Royal KPN NV executive Stan Miller as chief executive officer.

title: Trump Family Launches Branded Mobile Phone Service in US
content: President Donald Trump’s family is getting into the mobile phone business with a Trump-branded service that will rely on pre-existing wireless networks and hardware that is “made in America.”

title: CoreWeave Downgraded But Gets Street-High Price Target at Bank of America
content: CoreWeave Inc. was downgraded at Bank of America, with the firm citing valuation after shares of the cloud-computing provider quadrupled in recent months.

title: Entain Jumps Most Since 2021 on BetMGM Guidance Upgrade
content: Entain Plc shares jumped the most in more than three-and-a-half years after the sports betting and gaming group upgraded its full-year revenue guidance for BetMGM, the US-based joint venture it shares with MGM Resorts International.

title: Air Taxi Firm Archer Sees More Defense Demand in Near Term
content: Electric aircraft maker Archer Aviation Inc. expects its defense-related sales outstripping commercial air taxis in the short term.

title: Unicorn Juniper Square Sells Picks and Shovels of Private Market Boom
content: The financial technology startup has raised $130 million offering software to private investors.

title: Samsung Is Building a Hub for Patients to Share Data with Doctors
content: An attendee inspects a Galaxy Watch Ultra smartwatch at the Samsung Electronics Co. Unpacked launch in Paris.

title: WhatsApp to Show Ads, Offer Paid Subscriptions for First Time
content: Meta Platforms Inc. will begin showing ads inside of its WhatsApp messaging service, opening a new potential revenue stream while the company invests heavily in artificial intelligence and other long-term projects.

title: Picton Plans More AI, Technology Hiring in Canadian Firm’s Growth Push
content: Canadian hedge fund manager David Picton says artificial intelligence will be a disruptive force for the money management industry, and his firm is looking to expand its technology capabilities as part of its growth plan.

title: Roku Shares Jump on Amazon-Connected TV Advertising Partnership
content: Roku Inc. shares gain 11% premarket after the company and Amazon.com Inc.’s Amazon Ads announced a partnership, saying that advertisers will now have access to more than 80% of US households with connected TV though the Amazon DSP marketing tool.

title: Humanoid Robot Development Seen as Vital to the Future of Manufacturing
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ed Ludlow reports on the development of humanoid robots and their importance to the future of manufacturing.

title: How a Tiny Middleman Could Access Two-Factor Login Codes From Tech Giants
content: An investigation into the complexity of the global telecom system shows weaknesses in the transmission of secret codes sent via SMS.

title: Imax Adds China Screens With Wanda, Betting on Blockbusters
content: Imax Corp.’s Chinese arm is aggressively adding screens across the country, betting on big local and US productions to boost its sales in the world’s second-largest film market.

title: Apple Risks Fresh EU Charge Sheet Over App Store Curbs
content: Apple Inc. is edging toward another charge sheet from European Union antitrust watchdogs unless it quickly fixes alleged violations of a new digital law that led to a €500 million ($579 million) fine earlier this year.

title: Bitcoin Buyer Metaplanet Is Now Bigger Than Chipmaker Kioxia
content: Japan’s hotelier-turned-Bitcoin-buyer Metaplanet Inc. overtook memory chipmaker Kioxia Holdings Corp. in terms of market capitalization as the stock soared nearly 400% in less than two months, riding the global crypto rally.

title: Irish State Exits AIB, Putting Bank Into Private Ownership
content: The Irish state has disposed of the remainder of its shareholding in AIB Group plc, putting the bank into private ownership.

title: BOJ to Slow Bond Market Withdrawal After Standing Pat on Rates
content: The Bank of Japan stood pat on its interest rate and unveiled a plan to step back from the bond market at a slower pace from next year, in a sign of caution following heightened market volatility.

title: Reeves Weighs Reversing Non-Dom Inheritance Tax Changes, FT Says
content: Rachel Reeves is considering reversing a decision to charge inheritance tax on the overseas assets of non-doms, according to the Financial Times.

title: More Central Banks Than Ever Plan to Build Up Their Gold Hoards
content: A record share of the world’s central banks plans to accumulate more gold over the next 12 months, drawn by bullion’s performance during times of crisis and protection against inflation.

title: Global Euro Moment Needs Decisive Action, ECB’s Lagarde Says
content: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde called on policymakers to seize the moment and increase the euro’s global profile as Donald Trump’s policies undermines confidence in the US dollar.

title: Bank of England’s Finances Squeezed in Wake of Bernanke Reforms
content: For centuries the Bank of England has been the guardian of Britain’s financial health. Now the central bank is facing a budget crunch of its own as it repairs dilapidated IT infrastructure, ramps up hiring and overhauls the way it makes forecasts in response to Ben Bernanke’s review.

title: RBI May Have Easing Room if Inflation Undershoots, Governor Says
content: India’s central bank may have space for further policy easing if inflation undershoots its projections, according to Governor Sanjay Malhotra.

title: Tourism Dip Fuels Worst Stock Drop in Asia at Thai Airport Firm
content: Thailand’s post-Covid flood of tourists has turned into more of a trickle, adding to concerns for Airports of Thailand Pcl as it grapples with shrinking duty-free sales without a full-time chief executive officer.

title: China Housing Demand to Stay at 75% Below Peak, Goldman Says
content: China’s demand for new homes in cities is expected to stay at 75% below its 2017 peak in the coming years due to a shrinking population and expectations of price declines that have been hurting investment interest, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.

title: Brazil Congress Threatens to Deal Fresh Blow to Lula Fiscal Plan
content: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s efforts to shore up Brazil’s budget are on the brink of another setback after Congress advanced a push to block tax increases on some financial transactions from taking effect.

title: Carney Says Canada and US Aiming For Trade Deal Within 30 Days
content: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Canada and the US are aiming to strike a trade deal within a month, a goal set during a meeting with US President Donald Trump at the Group of Seven summit.

title: Trump, Starmer Agree to Implement Tariff-Cutting Trade Deal
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer reached an agreement with US President Donald Trump to implement trading terms disclosed last month to slash US tariffs on key British exports and raise UK quotas on certain American agricultural products.

title: Wary of Global Tensions, Zimbabwe Holds Interest Rates at 35%
content: Zimbabwe, wary of a rise in global tensions, resolved to leave its bank policy rate unchanged at 35%, according to John Mushayavanhu, the central bank governor.

title: Senate Deadlocked on SALT, With Draft Bill Showing Current $10,000 Cap
content: The Senate’s version of President Donald Trump’s tax bill calls for a $10,000 cap on the state and local tax deduction — a placeholder figure as Republicans remain divided over the valuable tax break.

title: Hungary Sells $4 Billion in Bonds to Fund Orban’s Budget Gap
content: Hungary sold $4 billion in a three-part dollar debt deal on Monday after the government decided to boost overseas borrowing to fund its budget.

title: G-7 Works to Secure Critical Minerals in Face of China Curbs
content: The Group of Seven leading economies are working to shore up supplies of critical minerals as they seek to move away from reliance on China for materials used in everything from mobile phones to wind turbines.

title: Trump to Leave G-7 Tonight Due to Middle East Crisis
content: Attendees at the G7 Media Centre before the G7 Leaders' Summit in Banff, Alberta, on June 15. Photographer: Gavin John/Bloomberg

title: Nigeria’s Annual Inflation Rate Slows for Second Month in a Row
content: Nigeria’s annual inflation rate cooled for a second straight month, giving policymakers a clearer picture of price trends after a data revamp in January clouded the outlook.

title: Canada Home Sales Up for First Time in Six Months on Trade Hopes
content: Home sales in Canada rose for the first time in six months in May as buyers’ confidence strengthened amid a de-escalation of trade tensions with the US.

title: SNB Set to Cut to Zero But Shirk From Negative Rate for Now
content: The Swiss National Bank will probably lower its interest rate to zero this week and stay there for some time, a Bloomberg survey of economists showed, just as new government forecasts pointed to persistently slow inflation.

title: New York Factory Activity Contracts While Outlook Improves
content: New York state factory activity shrank in June by more than projected as orders and shipments contracted, though expectations improved.

title: Brazil 2025 Inflation Forecasts Fall Ahead of Key Rate Decision
content: Brazil’s 2025 year-end inflation expectations dropped for third straight week, just before central bankers meet to decide whether or not to extend their cycle of interest rate hikes.

title: US Allies and Adversaries Are Dodging Trump’s Tariff Threats
content: Leaders aren’t racing to make deals despite White House pressure.

title: Ireland Signals Budget Caution on Rising Global Trade Risks
content: Irish government ministers have warned public finances will need to be more carefully managed, signaling a shift in approach ahead of the next budget as global trade turmoil is expected to slow growth in the small, open economy.

title: Most Common US Occupation at Risk From Immigration Crackdown
Trump Arrives at G-7 With Contentious Tariff Baggage in Tow
content: When Donald Trump gets down to business with his fellow Group of Seven leaders in the Canadian Rockies on Monday, top of the agenda will be the latest conflict between Iran and Israel and the threat it poses to both Middle East stability and the global economy.

title: America’s Home Health Workforce Is at Risk From Trump’s Immigration Crackdown
content: President Donald Trump’s immigration crackdown threatens to shrink the workforce for one of America’s fastest growing jobs: Home health and personal care aides.

title: Sri Lanka’s Growth Cools as Monetary Policy Easing Renewed
content: The Sri Lankan economy grew at a slower pace last quarter, as a high base is beginning to catch up.

title: India Trade Gap Shrinks in May Despite Rising Global Strains
content: India posted a narrower trade deficit in May, even as global supply chains remained under strain from sweeping US tariffs.

title: China’s Consumer Boom Seen Temporary as Weak Sentiment Persists
content: China’s unexpectedly strong retail sales in May gave the economy some relief from US tariffs, although the momentum may not last as deflationary forces persist and a housing market slump shows signs of deepening.

title: Häagen-Dazs, Starbucks Mull Overhauls in China to Fend Off Powerful Local Rivals
content: The consumer landscape in China was very different in the 1990s, when Häagen-Dazs and Starbucks ventured in with premium products that were alien to most people. They made huge inroads nonetheless, opening outlets at breakneck pace and raking in revenue. But times are changing, and they, like many other Western brands, are reassessing their approach to the world’s second-biggest economy, including possibly selling their businesses.

title: Irish State Exits AIB, Putting Bank Into Private Ownership
content: The Irish state has disposed of the remainder of its shareholding in AIB Group plc, putting the bank into private ownership.

title: Cantor Fitzgerald Poaches 15-Person Team in Push Into Germany
content: Cantor Fitzgerald LP hired about 15 investment bankers and traders in Germany and is looking to open a new office in the country as it seeks to push deeper into European markets.

title: Mitsubishi Said in Advanced Talks on $8 Billion Aethon Deal
content: Mitsubishi Corp. is in advanced talks to buy the assets of Aethon Energy Management for close to $8 billion, people familiar with the matter said, in what would be the Japanese conglomerate’s biggest ever acquisition.

title: Reeves Weighs Reversing Non-Dom Inheritance Tax Changes, FT Says
content: Rachel Reeves is considering reversing a decision to charge inheritance tax on the overseas assets of non-doms, according to the Financial Times.

title: Sabadell Weighs Selling TSB as It Defends Against BBVA Bid
content: Banco Sabadell SA is considering a sale of its UK unit TSB as it steps up efforts to defend itself against a takeover by rival BBVA SA.

title: Abu Dhabi’s $19 Billion Offer Drives Push for Top LNG Ranks
content: Abu Dhabi is boosting its ambitions to build a top liquefied natural gas producer with its biggest energy deal, as the petrostate targets a market it sees as key to its economic growth.

title: China Eases Battery, Steel Scrap Import Rules to Aid Green Push
content: China is relaxing import regulations on scrap, a move that will support recycling of battery metals and help speed the green transition in the steel market.

title: Tourism Dip Fuels Worst Stock Drop in Asia at Thai Airport Firm
content: Thailand’s post-Covid flood of tourists has turned into more of a trickle, adding to concerns for Airports of Thailand Pcl as it grapples with shrinking duty-free sales without a full-time chief executive officer.

title: China Housing Demand to Stay at 75% Below Peak, Goldman Says
content: China’s demand for new homes in cities is expected to stay at 75% below its 2017 peak in the coming years due to a shrinking population and expectations of price declines that have been hurting investment interest, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.

title: Invepar Close to Signing Debt Standstill With Creditors
content: Invepar, a transport operations and services company that controls one of the busiest airports in Latin America, signed a 15-day standstill agreement with Mubadala Capital as it tries to restructure its debt out of court, according to a Mubadala spokesperson.

title: US Approves Sale of $2 Billion in Military Hardware to Australia
content: The US State Department has signed off on the potential sale of military hardware to Australia valued at an estimated $2 billion (A$3.1 billion), including fighter jet spare parts.

title: Chicago Billionaire’s New Soccer Stadium Wants Wrigley-Like Aura
content: Billionaire Joe Mansueto’s Chicago Fire FC is pushing its plan for a $650 million soccer stadium and supporters are invoking one of the city’s best-known landmarks as part of the sales pitch: Wrigley Field, home of baseball’s Chicago Cubs.

title: Senate Republicans Propose More Aggressive Medicaid Cuts to Help Pay for Tax Bill
content: Senate Republicans are proposing cuts to the Medicaid program for low-income and disabled people that are more aggressive than policies the House passed to help pay for President Donald Trump’s sweeping tax package.

title: Retailer Gabe’s in Talks to Give Keys to Lenders, Get More Cash
content: Warburg Pincus-backed Gabe’s is closing in on a debt deal that would hand over control of the discount retailer to some of its lenders, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: Bank Regulators Launch Effort to Combat Surge in Check Fraud
content: US bank regulators are looking at ways to help consumers and lenders lower the risk of check fraud, which has surged in recent years.

title: Moelis’ Incoming CEO Says Deal Pipeline Is Hitting Record Highs
content: Moelis & Co.’s incoming Chief Executive Officer Navid Mahmoodzadegan said the investment bank’s deal pipeline is touching record highs, with clients eager for transactions to bolster growth.

title: RFK Jr.’s Policy Moves Are Weakening Vaccine Infrastructure, Fired Advisers Say
content: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s decision to overhaul a key committee on vaccine policy has left the country’s vaccine infrastructure “critically weakened,” former members of the group said in a piece published in JAMA on Monday.

title: Second Teenage Boy Dies From Liver Failure After Sarepta Gene Therapy Treatment
content: Sarepta Therapeutics Inc. plummeted after reporting a second patient died of acute liver failure while being treated with its gene therapy for a rare muscle disorder.

title: Airbus Defense Chief Laments ‘Tricky’ Europe Fighter Jet Union
content: Airbus SE’s defense chief bemoaned fresh infighting with French partner Dassault Aviation SA on their European fighter-jet program as concerns mount over delays, and called for closer collaboration with a UK-led rival.

title: Herbal Medicine Stock With No Sales Sees Rally Top 46,000%
content: A biotech stock focused on herbal medicine has surged by more than 46,000% so far this year and yet, the company itself has made zero revenue — much less turned a profit.

title: Victoria’s Secret Pressured by Second Investor Urging Change
content: Victoria’s Secret & Co. is being targeted by another activist investor seeking a shake-up of its business.

title: UnitedHealth Cuts Commissions on Some Medicare Advantage Plans
content: UnitedHealth Group Inc. is cutting commissions for brokers on some Medicare Advantage plans, according to documents reviewed by Bloomberg News, a move that appears designed to discourage agents from selling those plans.

title: Embraer Feels Sting of Geopolitics After Losing Deal to Airbus
content: The politics of aircraft sales were on full display last month when President Donald Trump, touring the Middle East, helped bring home the biggest widebody order in Boeing Co.’s history.

title: Oil Drops on Signs Conflict May Spare Iranian Crude Production
content: Oil fell on signs that the conflict in the Middle East may avoid disrupting crude production, with Iran seeking to deescalate hostilities with Israel.

title: Red Lobster CEO Wins Back Diners With New Menu, Friendlier Service
content: Red Lobster’s new CEO said customer feedback has improved significantly since the restaurant chain emerged from bankruptcy with a revamped menu and a renewed focus on hospitality.

title: EDF Says New Reactor-Pipe Crack Won’t Reduce Nuclear Output
content: Electricite de France SA said the new stress-corrosion crack in a pipe at the Civaux 2 reactor won’t reduce nuclear output this year or beyond because the issue will be repaired quickly.

title: Warner Bros. Wins Support From Bondholders for Debt Overhaul
content: Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. said it won enough support from creditors to overhaul its debt as part of a plan to split into two separate companies, a significant victory for the entertainment giant as it tries to turn itself around.

title: Apollo’s $1.4 Billion Lottomatica Exit Leads European Block Wave
content: An Apollo Global Management Inc. investment vehicle offered a €1.2 billion ($1.4 billion) stake in Italian betting firm Lottomatica Group Spa on Monday, leading a wave of European block trades as investors capitalize on the market’s bounce despite uncertainty.

title: Ex-Shell US Oil Trading Boss Claims He’s Owed $29 Million Bonus
content: Shell Plc’s former head of oil trading in the US was stiffed on his 2020 bonus by more than $29 million, he claims in a lawsuit that shines a light on compensation inside the oil major’s lucrative trading unit.

title: Here Are The Fintech Companies That Could Go Public In 2025

title: Fintech Funding Holds Strong As Airwallex Lands $300M

title: Proofpoint To Buy Hornetsecurity For Around $1B

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: What Seed Trends Say About The Future: Live Long, Recycle And Launch More Satellites
content: After plowing through a huge pile of seed funding rounds, we identified four areas where seed is trending this year: longevity, defense, waste reduction and spacetech. Here's where a lot of that investment is going.

title: A Deep Dive Into The Leading Investors In Unicorns Minted Since 2023
content: Since 2023, 259 new unicorns have joined The Crunchbase Unicorn Board, adding $605 billion in total value and altogether raising $130 billion, Crunchbase data shows. We take a look at who's leading new investments.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.
